thread.title: 'The Martian' opening rockets near October box office record
thread.title_full: 'The Martian' opening rockets near October box office record

title: 'The Martian' opening rockets near October box office record
text:
Tune in to our newscasts streaming live at the following times: 
News 3 This Morning: Weekdays 4:30 a.m.-7 a.m.News 3 at Noon: Weekdays at NoonLive at Five: Weekdays at 5 p.m.-5:30 p.m.News 3 at 5:30: Sun. at 5:30â€¦ David Cassidy charged in Florida mishap Celebrity's lawyer disputes police version of events Published On: Oct 04 2015 03:08:30 AM CDT Updated On: Oct 04 2015 12:33:07 PM CDT St. Lucie County Sheriff's Department 
His profile rose again, for the wrong reasons, thanks to a November 2010 DUI arrest in Florida. FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. - 
Former "Partridge Family" star David Cassidy has been charged by authorities in Florida with leaving the scene of a traffic accident last month. Related Content Polls: Trump still tops in Iowa, NH By Eric Bradner CNN 
The Broward County State Attorney's Office charged Cassidy, 65, of Fort Lauderdale, Wednesday with leaving the scene of the Sept. 9 accident, driving with an expired tag, improper lane change and driving with a suspended license, the SunSentinel reported Friday. 
The entertainment news website TMZ reported a witness told police Cassidy stopped after sideswiping a truck on Interstate 595 but then attempted to cover up his license plate before driving away with a flat tire. TMZ said it tried to reach Cassidy but had not heard back from him. 
Cassidy has an arraignment hearing set for Oct. 27, the Broward County newspaper said . 
His attorney, Jason Forman, said Cassidy provided his driver license and registration information before driving to a hospital for a matter unrelated to the accident.. 
"There's certainly a lot of major inconsistencies in the report," Forman said Friday. 
The singer-actor, who became a teenage heartthrob when he starred in the 1970s TV show "The Patridge Family," has three DUI arrests on his record since 2010 in Florida, New York and California, the newspaper said.
